title: Algorithms
author: Robert Sedgewick, Kevin Wayne
description: A comprehensive introduction to algorithms and data structures, covering fundamental concepts with practical applications.

title: ASP.NET in Action
author: David S. Platt
description: A practical guide to building dynamic web applications with ASP.NET, focusing on real-world scenarios and best practices.

title: Async Rust
author: Andrew K. Peterson
description: A guide to writing asynchronous applications in Rust, focusing on concurrency and parallelism.

title: Amazon Web Services in Action
author: Michael Wittig, Andreas Wittig
description: A comprehensive guide to using Amazon Web Services (AWS) for cloud-based infrastructure and application development.

title: The Cat's Guide to Programming
author: Frank S. Chodorow
description: A fun, introductory guide to programming for beginners, using cats as a metaphor to explain complex concepts.

title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A guide to writing clean, maintainable, and scalable code, emphasizing best practices in software development.

title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A guide to the professional attitudes and behaviors that software developers need to cultivate to succeed in their careers.

title: Clean Agile: Back to Basics
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A deep dive into Agile principles and practices, focusing on the importance of discipline and simplicity.

title: Clojure for the Brave and True
author: Daniel Higginbotham
description: An engaging and humorous introduction to the Clojure programming language, aimed at both beginners and experienced developers.

title: Cloud Security and Privacy
author: Tim Mather, Subra Kumaraswamy, Shahed Latif
description: A comprehensive guide to understanding the security and privacy concerns in cloud computing, and how to address them.

title: COBOL for the 21st Century
author: Nancy B. Stern, Robert A. Stern
description: An introduction to COBOL, focusing on its relevance and use in modern enterprise applications.

title: C Pointers and Memory Management
author: Kenneth Reek
description: A guide to understanding pointers in C programming and how to manage memory effectively in software applications.

title: C++ Programming Language
author: Bjarne Stroustrup
description: The definitive reference on C++, written by the creator of the language, covering all aspects of C++ programming.

title: C++ Software Design
author: Stephen C. Dewhurst
description: A guide to designing software systems using C++, focusing on advanced techniques and principles of object-oriented design.

title: CSS in Depth
author: Keith J. Grant
description: A comprehensive guide to mastering CSS, covering advanced techniques and best practices for modern web design.

title: Database Design for Mere Mortals
author: Michael J. Hernandez
description: An introduction to database design, focusing on the fundamentals of relational databases and how to structure data effectively.

title: DevOps: A Software Architect's Perspective
author: Len Bass, Ingo Weber, Liming Zhu
description: An exploration of the DevOps movement and its impact on software architecture, offering practical advice and case studies.

title: Django in Action
author: Daniel Roy Greenfeld, Audrey Roy Greenfeld
description: A practical guide to building dynamic web applications with Django, covering its core features and advanced techniques.

title: Embedded Systems Design
author: Peter Marwedel
description: A comprehensive guide to the design of embedded systems, focusing on both hardware and software aspects.

title: Fluent C#
author: Antonio Cisternino
description: A guide to mastering C# programming, focusing on functional programming, LINQ, and other advanced C# features.

title: Flutter for Beginners
author: Alessandro Biessek
description: A beginner-friendly guide to building mobile applications with the Flutter framework, covering both Dart programming and UI design.

title: Functional Programming in Java
author: Venkat Subramaniam
description: An introduction to functional programming principles, applying them to the Java programming language to improve code quality.

title: Unity 3D Game Development by Example
author: Ryan Henson Creighton
description: A hands-on guide to building games with Unity 3D, using examples to demonstrate various game development techniques.

title: Git Pocket Guide
author: Richard E. Silverman
description: A compact guide to Git, covering essential commands and workflows for effective version control.

title: Head First Go
author: Jay McGavren
description: A learner-friendly introduction to the Go programming language, using engaging visuals and examples.

title: Grokking Artificial Intelligence Algorithms
author: Rishal Hurbans
description: An accessible guide to understanding and implementing AI algorithms, with practical examples.

title: Kubernetes: Up and Running
author: Kelsey Hightower, Brendan Burns, Joe Beda
description: A comprehensive guide to Kubernetes, explaining how to deploy, manage, and scale containerized applications.

title: Kafka: The Definitive Guide
author: Neha Narkhede, Gwen Shapira, Todd Palino
description: An in-depth look at Apache Kafka, covering its architecture, use cases, and best practices.

title: Kali Linux Revealed
author: Raphael Hertzog, Jim O'Gorman, Mati Aharoni
description: A comprehensive guide to Kali Linux, focusing on penetration testing and security assessments.

title: Kanban: Successful Evolutionary Change for Your Technology Business
author: David J. Anderson
description: An introduction to Kanban, providing strategies for improving processes and efficiency in technology businesses.

title: Laravel: Up & Running
author: Matt Stauffer
description: A practical guide to the Laravel PHP framework, covering its features and how to build applications with it.

title: Lean DevOps: A Practical Guide to On-Demand Service Delivery
author: Robert Benefield
description: A guide to integrating Lean principles with DevOps practices for efficient service delivery.

title: Machine Learning Yearning
author: Andrew Ng
description: A guide to structuring machine learning projects, offering insights into the practical aspects of building AI systems.

title: Building Microservices: Designing Fine-Grained Systems
author: Sam Newman
description: An exploration of microservices architecture, discussing its benefits, challenges, and best practices.

title: Node.js Design Patterns
author: Mario Casciaro, Luciano Mammino
description: A deep dive into design patterns and best practices for building scalable Node.js applications.

title: Game Physics Engine Development
author: Ian Millington
description: A guide to developing physics engines for games, covering the mathematical and computational principles involved.

title: Head First Python
author: Paul Barry
description: An engaging introduction to Python programming, using the Head First series' visual and interactive approach.

title: Head First JavaScript Programming
author: Eric Freeman, Elisabeth Robson
description: A learner-friendly guide to JavaScript, using the Head First series' unique teaching methodology.

title: Head First Java
author: Kathy Sierra, Bert Bates
description: An interactive and engaging introduction to Java programming, part of the Head First series.

title: Head First Kotlin
author: Dawn Griffiths, David Griffiths
description: A beginner-friendly guide to Kotlin programming, using the Head First series' visual approach.

title: Learning React: Functional Web Development with React and Redux
author: Alex Banks, Eve Porcello
description: An introduction to building web applications with React and Redux, focusing on functional programming concepts.

title: React: Up & Running
author: Stoyan Stefanov
description: A practical guide to getting started with React, covering its core concepts and application development.

title: RESTful Web APIs
author: Leonard Richardson, Mike Amundsen, Sam Ruby
description: A comprehensive guide to designing RESTful web APIs, covering principles, patterns, and best practices.

title: Robust Python
author: Patrick Viafore
description: A guide to writing reliable and maintainable Python code, focusing on best practices and design patterns.

title: The Ruby Programming Language
author: David Flanagan, Yukihiro Matsumoto
description: An authoritative guide to Ruby, written by the language's creator, Yukihiro Matsumoto.

title: Rust Programming by Example
author: Guillaume Gomez, Antoni Boucher
description: A practical guide to learning Rust by building real-world projects and applications.

title: Scala for the Impatient
author: Cay S. Horstmann
description: A quick-start guide to Scala for developers familiar with Java, covering its key features and syntax.

title: The Linux Command Line: A Complete Introduction
author: William E. Shotts Jr.
description: A thorough introduction to the Linux command line, covering shell scripting and command-line utilities.

title: Smalltalk Best Practice Patterns
author: Kent Beck
description: A collection of best practices and patterns for Smalltalk programming, emphasizing simplicity and effectiveness.

title: Security Engineering: A Guide to Building Dependable Distributed Systems
author: Ross J. Anderson
description: An in-depth guide to security engineering, focusing on building dependable and secure distributed systems.

title: SQL Cookbook: Query Solutions and Techniques for Database Developers
author: Anthony Molinaro
description: A collection of practical solutions to common SQL challenges, providing techniques for efficient database querying.

title: Think Java: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist
author: Allen B. Downey, Chris Mayfield
description: An introduction to programming with Java, emphasizing problem-solving and computational thinking.

title: JUnit in Action
author: Vincent Massol, Ted Husted
description: A guide to writing and running unit tests with JUnit, covering best practices and strategies for test-driven development.

title: Vue.js Up and Running
author: Callum Macrae
description: An introduction to building web applications with Vue.js, covering its core features and best practices.
